author: S P
text:
K. Prithika Yashini (25), a transgender whose application was initially rejected by the Tamil Nadu Uniformed Services Recruitment Board (TNUSRB) over her gender choice, has received the appointment order as Sub-Inspector of police here on Monday.

She is one of the 22 persons, including five women, who received their appointment orders from City Police Commissioner Sumit Sharan here.

When the TNUSRB invited applications to fill 1,087 SI posts last year, her application was rejected stating that she did not fall under the available two categories of gender.

She moved the Madras High Court and was allowed to take the written test, physical endurance test and viva-voce.

Her long legal battle finally succeeded with the First Bench comprising Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice Pushpa Sathyanarayana passing orders in November, 2015 that enabled her to be recruited as SI, though she missed the 100 metre dash by a second.

Addressing the media here on Monday, she said her journey was very difficult. Expressing happiness over being the country’s first transgender Sub-Inspector, she vowed to fight against foeticide and prevent crime against women apart from stressing for reservation for transgenders in education and jobs. “My aim is to become an IPS officer,” she said.
title: Transgender SI ready to take charge
